results.title: Miffy at the zoo
results.creator_credit: Hertogenbosch, Meulenoff, Kodansha, Hilversham, Palm Plus and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Miffy, Dick Bruna’s lovable white rabbit is off to the zoo with her father. They travel by train and see lots of animals. The seven other stories are: 1. The Christmas book. - 2. The Circus. - 3. Another story to tell. - 4. Miffy at the playground. - 5. Snuffy’s puppies. - 6. The Fish. - 7. Poppy pig. The bold colours and solid shapes of the illustrations, accompanied by simple but entertaining stories make this highly suitable for young children.

results.title: Miffy at the hospital
results.brief_description: Based on the delightful children’s books by Dick Bruna about Miffy, the white rabbit, this tape includes 8 adventures with Miffy including: The Orchestra- Miffy at the hospital- Poppy’s birthday- The School- The Little Bird- Cinderella- Red Riding Hood and The Apple. Suitable for young children.

results.title: Miffy
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Hertogenbosch, Meulenoff, Kodansha, Hilvershum and Palm Plus
results.brief_description: Miffy is a familiar friend to generations of very young children. Together with Snuffy, Farmer John, Poppy Pig, Boris and Barbara, she features in the family of characters from Dick Bruna’s much loved children’s books. These simple yet captivating stories will take children into the delightful world of Miffy and her friends. 1-Miffy 2-Miffy’s bicycle 3-Miffy at school 4-I Know about numbers 5-Miffy goes flying 6-Farmer John 7-Miffy’s dream 8-Snuffy.

results.title: Midwife: with woman
results.creator_credit: Maternity Centre Association and Mary Paul Wells
results.brief_description: This film traces the history of midwifery in America, describing its prominent role in colonial times, and its gradual restriction through professional standardisation. It also shows the process through which midwifery has regained acceptance and the film emphasises the view that pregnancy is not an illness and childbirth is not a surgical operation. Narrated by Mariette Hartley.

results.title: Midnite spares
results.creator_credit: Tom Burstall, Filmco and Quentin Masters
results.brief_description: A group of criminals strip cars for their parts and are involved in a kidnapping. When the man’s son returns home after a long absence, he embarks on a chaotic rescue mission with the help of a few friends. Stars James Laurie, Gia Carides, Max Cullen and Bruce Spence.

results.title: Midnight in the garden of good and evil
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Arnold Stiefel and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood directed this adaptation of John Berendt’s non-fiction best-seller about a Savannah, Georgia, murder case. As the film begins, New York journalist, John Kelso (John Cusack), arrives in Savannah to do a brief article on the annual Christmas party given by sophisticated, urbane antique dealer, Jim Williams (Kevin Spacey). After the party, Williams kills his violent lover, Billy, explaining it as self defence. Kelso decides to stay in Savannah to cover the trial, encountering a variety of colourful locals and eccentrics. Cast includes Kevin Spacey, John Cusack, Jack Thompson, Alison Eastwood and Jude Law.

results.title: Midnight express [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Puttnam, Casablanca Films and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: A young tourist, Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), travelling in Turkey is arrested for possession of hashish. The film traces his experiences, often violent and terrifying, in a foreign jail and his attempts to escape and cross the border into freedom. The cast also features John Hurt and Randy Quaid with a script by Oliver Stone. The film is based on Billy Hughes’ book of the same title relating his jail experiences.

results.title: Midnight dancers = Sibak
results.brief_description: This low-budget portrait of three brothers who make a living in Manila as “Macho Dancers” or “sibak” (a slang term for male prostitutes), filmed in the streets and in the bars of Manila, offers a rare insight into gay culture in the Philippines. The eldest, who at 23 is verging on being too old for his profession, has a wife and child but is also openly involved with a wealthy older man. The second brother lives a life on the streets selling his body while attempting to avoid the violently homophobic police. Against the admonishments of his mother, the youngest travels to the city to join his brothers in the sex trade. He soon becomes romantically involved with a transvestite and they begin a steady relationship. Faced with the harsh reality of poverty, their mother is forced to accept her sons efforts to support the family. Although the direction and performances are uneven, and the voyeuristic focus on the dancers lithe bodies overly gratuitous the film is an indictment of the abhorrent conditions of crime, poverty and homophobia faced by sex workers in the Philippines. Cast: Ryan Aristorenas, Perla Bautista, Richard Cassity.
